meanings.definition: A person who deceives or cheats others.
meanings.sent1: The cogger tricked his friends into believing his lies.
meanings.sent2: She realized her friend was a cogger when he stole her money.
meanings.sent3: The cogger's tall tales always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a mask, hiding the cogger within.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the cogger's smooth words and false promises.

meanings.sent1: He tried to cogger his way out of trouble by blaming others.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after coggering her sister out of her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The magician coggered the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to cogger the truth, hiding it from view.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's plan was to cogger the wealthy businessman out of his fortune.

meanings.sent1: The advertisement was full of cogger, promising miracles in a bottle.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often use cogger to sway public opinion in their favor.
meanings.sent3: The gossip at school was nothing but silly cogger.
meanings.sent4: The fog acted as a natural cogger, obscuring the path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The email was a clever cogger, leading him to click on a dangerous link.
